page.title: 06COMMUNICATIONS
page.content: Greenholm postal sorting office was opened in October 1962 and provides extra facilities for the distribution of mail in the area.Up to this time the local church halls were used during the Christmas period where students were employed temporarily to deliver mail. With the rise in postal charges the hiring of large numbers of students has stopped. The traffic control room,West Midlands Police based at Thornbridge Ave.has 21 closed-circuit cameras focused on the motorway system,stretching from Bentley junction to Coleshill and from Frankley services to Gravelly Hill interchange. 2x4 screens are continually monitored. The 3 computers are concerned with signals;the Police National Computer, which deals with stolen cars etc. and the West Midlands Police Computer are controlled from here.
